name: Hongkong
title: Hongkong - Traveling China like your home yard
overview: Hong Kong is a vibrant metropolis where East meets West, featuring stunning skylines, bustling markets, and beautiful natural landscapes. Known for its iconic Victoria Harbour, world-class shopping, and diverse culinary scene, Hong Kong offers a unique blend of Chinese tradition and international modernity.

highlights.attractions: Victoria Peak, Victoria Harbour, Tsim Sha Tsui, Big Buddha, Ocean Park
highlights.cuisine: Dim Sum, Roast Goose, Egg Waffles, Hong Kong-style Milk Tea
highlights.bestTime: Autumn (October-December) and Spring (March-May) with comfortable weather

dishes.name: Dim Sum
dishes.description: Traditional Cantonese small plates served with tea, featuring dumplings, buns, and pastries.

dishes.name: Roast Goose
dishes.description: Perfectly roasted goose with crispy skin and tender meat, a Hong Kong specialty.

dishes.name: Egg Waffles
dishes.description: Popular street snack with crispy exterior and soft, eggy interior.

foodStreets.name: Temple Street Night Market
foodStreets.description: Famous night market with street food, fortune tellers, and local atmosphere.

foodStreets.name: Mongkok Food Streets
foodStreets.description: Multiple food streets in Mongkok offering diverse local and international cuisine.

gettingThere: By Air: Hong Kong International Airport (HKG), major international hub
By Train: High-speed rail connects to mainland China cities
By Ferry: Regular ferry services from Macau and mainland China
gettingAround: MTR: Efficient subway system covering all major areas
Bus: Comprehensive bus network including double-decker buses
Tram: Historic Peak Tram and Hong Kong Tramways
Star Ferry: Iconic ferry service across Victoria Harbour

activities: Morning: Take Peak Tram to Victoria Peak for panoramic views
Afternoon: Explore Central and Sheung Wan districts
Evening: Watch Symphony of Lights show from Tsim Sha Tsui
Morning: Visit Big Buddha and Po Lin Monastery on Lantau Island
Afternoon: Explore Temple Street Night Market
Evening: Enjoy authentic dim sum dinner
Morning: Visit Hong Kong Museum of History
Afternoon: Shop in Causeway Bay and explore street markets
Evening: Harbor cruise and seafood dinner
